reviewText: This is a concise guide to the book.  Just a little long for some of us but worthwhile to those of us who want to understand the full story rather than just the movie version.  It bring perspective to Markus Zusak's thoughts behind the book.
Couldn't here it very well on any computer or tv. Not what I expected.

Beyond the very clean prose, the author develops clear relationships among the characters.  Some good guys, some bad guys, and some both like most of us.  One hated reading the tragic sections, but Crayola portrays the inevitability of these outcomes very sympathetically, not just efficiently.  I really enjoyed this book and was disappointed at not getting to see the film.  I'll order it on Netflix soon.

I have read many books about WWII and the Holocaust. I like that this one is told from the perspective of a German who did not stand with Hitler. I also enjoyed "hearing" death speak so compassionately about its victims.
Really good book could not put it down  its weird to have death telling a story parts are sad but it is worth the read
This was not exactly what I thought it would be but I found it to clarify some points of the story and movie.
I have not read The Book Thief and wanted a review of the book in anticipation of the movie.  This is a good explanation of the many facets of the book and I would recommend it to those interested.
Good presentation of historical background ... Story elements and themes ... German vocabulary ... Brief summary of each Part helps with overall comprehension of the novel.
I accidently purchased this item because I thought I was buying the book.  Should of known the price was too good to be true.
